content:
SpotLight Class

Definition

Light object that projects its effect in a cone-shaped area along a specified direction.

In this Article

public sealed class SpotLight : System.Windows.Media.Media3D.PointLightBase

Remarks

SpotLight is a kind of PointLight, since it has a position, range, and attenuation. However, SpotLight also allows you to control the direction, shape, and other properties of the cone of the light's effect.

Specify values for OuterConeAngle (beyond which nothing is illuminated), and InnerConeAngle (within which everything is fully illuminated) to change the spotlighting effect.

Lighting between the outside of the inner cone and the outer cone falls off linearly.

Constructors

SpotLight()

Initializes a new instance of the SpotLight class.

public SpotLight ();

SpotLight(Color,Point3D,Vector3D,Double,Double)

Initializes a new instance of the SpotLight class using the specified color, position, direction, and cone angles.

public SpotLight (System.Windows.Media.Color diffuseColor, System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D position, System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D direction, double outerConeAngle, double innerConeAngle);
diffuseColor
Color

Diffuse color of the new SpotLight.

position
Point3D

Position of the new SpotLight.

direction
Vector3D

Direction of the new SpotLight.

outerConeAngle
Double

Angle that defines a cone outside which the light does not illuminate objects in the scene.

innerConeAngle
Double

Angle that defines a cone within which the light fully illuminates objects in the scene.

Fields

DirectionProperty

Identifies the stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.SpotLight.Direction* dependency property.

public static readonly System.Windows.DependencyProperty DirectionProperty;

InnerConeAngleProperty

Identifies the stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.SpotLight.InnerConeAngle* dependency property.

public static readonly System.Windows.DependencyProperty InnerConeAngleProperty;

OuterConeAngleProperty

Identifies the stem.Windows.Media.Media3D.SpotLight.OuterConeAngle* dependency property.

public static readonly System.Windows.DependencyProperty OuterConeAngleProperty;

Properties

Direction

Gets or sets a Vector3D that specifies the direction in which the SpotLight projects its light.

public System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D Direction { get; set; }
Value
Vector3D

Vector3D that specifies the direction of the Spotlight's projection. The default value is 0,0,-1.

Remarks

Dependency Property Information
Identifier field DirectionProperty
Metadata properties set to true None

InnerConeAngle

Gets or sets an angle that specifies the proportion of a SpotLight's cone-shaped projection in which the light fully illuminates objects in the scene.

public double InnerConeAngle { get; set; }
Value
Double

The angle in degrees that specifies the proportion of a SpotLight's cone-shaped projection in which the light fully illuminates objects in the scene. The default value is 180.

Remarks

The intensity of the SpotLight's illumination diminishes from full illumination to none in that angle of the light's projection between the InnerConeAngle and the OuterConeAngle.

Dependency Property Information
Identifier field InnerConeAngleProperty
Metadata properties set to true None

OuterConeAngle

Gets or sets an angle that specifies the proportion of a SpotLight's cone-shaped projection outside which the light does not illuminate objects in the scene.

public double OuterConeAngle { get; set; }
Value
Double

The angle in degrees that specifies the proportion of a SpotLight's cone-shaped projection outside which the light does not illuminate objects in the scene. The default value is 90.

Remarks

The intensity of the SpotLight's illumination diminishes from full illumination to none in that angle of the light's projection between the InnerConeAngle and the OuterConeAngle. The light provides no illumination outside the angle specified by this property.

Dependency Property Information
Identifier field OuterConeAngleProperty
Metadata properties set to true None

Clone()

Creates a modifiable clone of this SpotLight, making deep copies of this object's values. When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.

public System.Windows.Media.Media3D.SpotLight Clone ();
Returns
SpotLight

A modifiable clone of the current object. The cloned object's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property will be false even if the source's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property was true.

Remarks

This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen Freezable objects (or any Freezable object). For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.

For more information, see Clone.

CloneCurrentValue()

Creates a modifiable clone of this SpotLight object, making deep copies of this object's current values. Resource references, data bindings, and animations are not copied, but their current values are.

public System.Windows.Media.Media3D.SpotLight CloneCurrentValue ();
Returns
SpotLight

A modifiable clone of the current object. The cloned object's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property will be false even if the source's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property was true.

Remarks

This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen Freezable objects (or any Freezable object). For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.

For more information, see CloneCurrentValue.
